title.narrative: 3.3. PUBLIC FINANCE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: Output 3.3: By the end of 2021, national capacities on child-sensitive public financial analysis and management are strengthened., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By the end of 2021, the most disadvantaged children benefit from enhanced evidence-based and integrated social protection and poverty reduction policies, programmes and institutions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.3: By the end of 2021, national capacities on child-sensitive public financial analysis and management are strengthened.

description.narrative: In 2021, Iran CO; continued to advocate for increasing;;child-sensitive public financial analysis and management since despite Govt. fiscal policies plans to reduce the double impact of sanctions and the pandemic,; the minimum basket of households have been reduced and vulnerabilities especially for households with children have increased. There is an urgency;to strengthen development planning and fiscal space to ensure sustainability; of welfare budget and position children at its heart for inclusive economic growth. The attractive 60% budget allocation for welfare (social protection, health, and education) has utilization vs expenditure issues.; | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:05/01/2022

title.narrative: Level of use of child-sensitive/child-focused budget and expenditure analyses to plan and monitor public finance in social sectors(46779), Text
